intro: Physeterostemon aonae, commonly known as the Hawaiian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has small, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
